chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles C Butterfield

defendant.name: Butterfield, Charles C
defendant.address: W8838 Thundercloud Rd, Blk River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: bond on file applied to costs in 15CF137.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.   Defendant plead guilty to count 1 in 15CF137 and to Count 1 in 15CT52.  Remaining counts, plus 16CF17, 15TR1422 and 15TR2423 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.   Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Prior OWI's confirmed with the defendant and Attorney Fredrickson. Felony warnings given.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of OWI 3rd, and Poss. with intent - THC, contrary to 961.41(1m)(h)(1) and OWI 3rd, contrary to 346.62(1)(a).  Joint recommendation for probation.  15CF137 -3 years.  15CT52- 2 years.  33 month driver's license revocation and IID, 155 days jail, all but first 14 days stayed.  $2,072.00 fine and costs.    AODA, recommended treatment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Participate in HTW court, if accepted into that court. 

Court ordered sentence withheld, 2 years probation in 15CT52.  33 month driver's license revocation and IID, 155 days jail, all but first 14 days stayed.  Start on or before 6/24/16 and 6 pm.  $2,072.00 fine and costs.    Pay monthly through probation. Alcohol assmt and DSP.    AODA, recommended treatment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Participate and follow through with recommendations in HTW court, if accepted into that court. 

3 years probation in 15CF137.  Concurrent.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC, DNA sample and surcharge.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Subject to frequent and random testing.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.   Participate and follow through with the recommendatsion in HTW court, if accepted into that court.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Have been set for plea/sentencing.
Status conference on May 9, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant appears with counsel SPD Paul Fredrickson.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Court reviews right to preliminary hearing with the defendant for 16CF17  Court finds the defendant KI waives his right to preliminary hearing and is bound over for trial.  State files Information with same charges as in complaint.  Defense waives the reading and defendant stands mute.  Court enters NGP.    15CF137 is set for jury trial on 6-30-16.  SPD Fredrickson asks to have until tomorrow to possibly work it out.  Status on 5-9-16 at 3:00 for all cases.

Waiver of Prelim on May 2, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Arraignment on May 2, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  No agreement yet.  WOPH and ARGN to be set for 5/2 at 2:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  No agreement yet.  Will be resolved.  Set for plea/sentencing.

Pre-trial conference at 02-24-2016 10:00 am.
Status conference at 03-14-2016 03:00 pm.

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of time limits.  Defendant understood.  Court found the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived the time limit for holding the preliminary hearing.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Reading of complaint waived.  PTC 2/24 STC 3/14 at 3 pm.  Bond continued.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Paul Fredrickson appeared specially.  Court recited the charges adn possible penalties contained in the complaint.  Bond set.  AIA set for 2/1 at 9 am.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.
